snippet: Many chief executives who had tumultuous reigns still remain board members of major public companies.
abstract: Many chief executives who had tumultuous reigns still remain board members of major public companies.

headline.main: 'Tainted,' but Still Serving on Corporate Boards

snippet: On Monday, researchers discovered that a type of malware continued to attack Apple computers through a security hole in Java software.
abstract: On Monday, researchers discovered that a type of malware continued to attack Apple computers through a security hole in Java software.

headline.main: A New Variant of Malware Takes Aim at Mac Users

snippet: Google spent $5.03 million on lobbying between January and March of this year, a record for the company, and a 240 percent increase from the same quarter a year ago, according to disclosures filed Friday.
abstract: Google spent $5.03 million on lobbying between January and March of this year, a record for the company, and a 240 percent increase from the same quarter a year ago, according to disclosures filed Friday.

headline.main: Under Scrutiny, Google Spends Record Amount on Lobbying

snippet: Many children are carrying backpacks that weigh as much as 15 percent of their body weight, a study finds, resulting in back pain and scoliosis.
abstract: Many children are carrying backpacks that weigh as much as 15 percent of their body weight, a study finds, resulting in back pain and scoliosis.

headline.main: Heavy Backpacks Can Spell Chronic Back Pain for Children
headline.print_headline: Personal Health: Heavy Backpacks Can Spell Chronic Back Pain for Children

snippet: Facebook said it would buy patents that Microsoft bought from AOL earlier this month, as the social networking giant seeks to bolster its defenses in a legal fight with Yahoo.
abstract: Facebook said it would buy patents that Microsoft bought from AOL earlier this month, as the social networking giant seeks to bolster its defenses in a legal fight with Yahoo.

headline.main: Microsoft Deal May Give Facebook Heft in Yahoo Patent Fight

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. DE LA MERCED

snippet: Political turmoil in France and the Netherlands cast fresh doubt on whether Europe would solve its debt crisis as a business slump continued on the Continent.

headline.main: Global Markets Veer Lower on Turbulence in Europe
headline.print_headline: European Debt Concerns Prompt a Major Sell-Off

snippet: NimbleTV is the latest example of technology companies trying to break into the closed system of television distribution in the United States.
abstract: Tech start-up NimbleTV is introducing a service to move a whole subscription's worth of TV onto the Web, with or without the subscription company's permission; move is latest example of technology companies trying to break into the closed system of television distribution in the United States.

headline.main: Start-Up Aims to Stream Pay TV Onto Web Devices
headline.print_headline: Start-Up Aims to Stream Pay TV Onto Web Devices

snippet: Data will include the Standard & Poor’s/Case-Shiller home price index for February, new home sales for March and consumer confidence for April.

headline.main: Looking Ahead to Economic Reports This Week

snippet: Ma Jun moved from journalist to environmentalist and now is dedicated to tracking down pollution along the supply chain used by major corporations.

headline.main: Advocate Helps Track Polluters on Supply Chain
headline.print_headline: Advocate Helps Track Polluters on Supply Chain

snippet: When David M. Poppe sat down a little over a week ago to write a letter to his investors, he knew he was taking an unusual step.     Mr. Poppe, who manages money for the Sequoia Fund, one of the most well-respected institutional investment firms i...
abstract: Andrew Ross Sorkin DealBook column observes that a call to vote against Goldman Sachs board member James A Johnson for being at 'the center of several egregious corporate governance debacles' has put a spotlight on other corporate boards and who sits on them. Photos (M)y
